column1: Uchi////Walking in on a Thursday night around 5 PM
column2: the interior was quite tight and crowded with people already. Service was just decent at best. Each server would go out of their way to describe the contents of each dish while placing it on the table. But other than that
column3: they didn't do anything else besides refill our water. Now onto the food. We went during happy hour to take advantage of their discounted menu items. Overall
column4: the food was just average at best. Don't get me wrong
column5: the presentation of each dish was outstanding. But I just couldn't help but expect so much more in terms of taste and texture given I was paying a premium price (even during happy hour). To my surprise
column6: the vegetarian dishes were way better than the non-vegetarian options. Here's a review of what we ordered:
